title: They Did Their Jobs Well
summary: Pence, Kudlow, Rao, Pai and more: Here are the Trump appointees and policies that served the country.. As the Trump Presidency ends in the disgrace of the Capitol riot, an effort is already underway to erase everything in the last four years as disgraceful too. That's a lie-a Big Lie, to borrow the cliché of the moment. Donald Trump's profound character flaws need to be separated from what so many people in his Administration accomplished for the country.

title: Harvard Accuses Elise Stefanik
summary: A dean declares a congresswoman unfit to serve as an adviser at her alma mater.. Elise Stefanik grew up in a working-class family in upstate New York, where her father and mother ran a small plywood distribution business. After getting accepted to Harvard, she became not only the first Ivy Leaguer in her family but also the first to graduate from college.

title: It Took a Strong America to Survive 2020
summary: But formidable global challenges await Joe Biden as he moves into the White House.. Xi Jinping, Vladimir Putin, Ali Khamenei, Nicolás Maduro and Kim Jong Un doubtless were gleefully munching their popcorn as the violent fringe of a large pro-Trump demonstration stormed the halls of Congress earlier this month. The rioting in Washington and the militarization of the capital for this week's inauguration telegraph American instability and weakness-something that cheered every U.S. adversary and alarmed every friend around the world.

title: Justices May Usher In the Modern Broadcast Age-Two Decades Late
summary: Since 2003, two activist judges on the Third Circuit have been arbitrarily stalling FCC innovation.. Two judges on the Third U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals have spent the past 17 years blocking a congressionally mandated modernization of antiquated broadcast-television regulations. The Supreme Court will hear an appeal Tuesday, FCC v. Prometheus Radio Project, giving broadcasters the chance to be unshackled from restrictions this activist court continues to impose on them-which are contrary to court precedent and statute and make no sense in light of the competition from digital media.

title: Notable & Quotable: Lies and Double Standards
summary: 'This issue is important and complex enough that I'm going to make today's newsletter a bit longer than usual.'. David Leonhardt and Stuart A. Thompson writing for the New York Times , Dec. 14, 2017:

title: 'The Spotify Play' Review: Better Than Piracy
summary: Daniel Ek wanted to bring Napster's idea of a musical smorgasbord into the world of legal streaming. Would record labels play along?. Neil Young, Stevie Nicks and Lindsey Buckingham owe Daniel Ek an enormous debt of gratitude right about now. The rock legends have all recently sold their song publishing rights for gigantic sums, sell-offs that can partially be attributed to the surge in digital revenue that accounts for more than half the global recorded-music market. One man saw all this coming before anyone else: Mr. Ek, the 37-year-old co-founder of Spotify, the world's largest streaming service with 320 million users and counting.

title: Renaissance Says Losses Should Have Been Expected at Some Point
summary: Quant hedge fund tells clients that drop of 20% to 30% was partly due to increased volatility. Quant pioneer Renaissance Technologies LLC sent clients an analysis of its performance and a rationalization of recent deep losses, an unusual move for one of Wall Street's most secretive firms.

title: Yellen Calls for More Aid to Avoid Longer, More Painful Recession
summary: Biden's pick to lead Treasury says Congress must 'act big' to boost economic recovery, fend off 'long-term scarring'. WASHINGTON-Janet Yellen, President-elect Joe Biden's choice for Treasury secretary, plans to tell lawmakers that the U.S. risks a longer, more painful recession unless Congress approves more aid and urge them to "act big" to shore up the recovery.

title: Oil Giant Total Buys Stake in World's Biggest Solar Developer
summary: French energy company to pay $2.5 billion for 20% of Adani Green Energy. LONDON-French energy giant Total SE said it would pay $2.5 billion for a 20% stake in the world's largest solar developer, the latest move by an oil major to expand in renewable power.

title: Private Companies Regulate Public Discourse
summary: If Vivek Ramaswamy and Jed Rubenfeld are correct that social-media companies are state actors, the policy of a free and open internet, embodied in the Telecommunications Act of 1996, is dead.. If Vivek Ramaswamy and Jed Rubenfeld are correct that social-media companies are state actors, the policy of a free and open internet, embodied in the Telecommunications Act of 1996, is dead ("Saving the Constitution from Big Tech," op-ed, Jan. 12). Indeed, every communications company-broadcast TV and radio, cable and satellite TV and radio, cellular carriers, app makers, news organizations-would always be state actors, because all of them are subject to carrots and sticks under different regulatory regimes. Through the fiat of a judicially created extension of the state-action doctrine to these private actors, Messrs. Ramaswamy and Rubenfeld's position would effectively nationalize the American media ecosystem. We might agree that the balance of regulatory carrots and sticks for big social-media companies is out of whack, but surely nationalizing the entire infosphere isn't the answer.

title: Nonstop Stimulus Is a Progressive's Nirvana
summary: Phil Gramm and Mike Solon argue that stimulus spending is all about political, not economic outcomes.. Phil Gramm and Mike Solon argue that "The Era of Nonstop Stimulus" (op-ed, Jan. 4) that began in response to the pandemic threatens to become an Obamanomics stimulus sequel on steroids. The Obama economy struggled to exceed 2% a year growth for eight years, as federal debt piled up. The Biden administration now plans to spend trillions of dollars more than the $3.3 trillion of stimulus since the pandemic began.

title: Global Stocks Edge Up as Investors Await Earnings Flurry
summary: Chinese shares rose after strong economic data. Global stocks and U.S. stock futures edged up on Monday, as investors awaited a busy week of corporate earnings, economic data and central-bank decisions.

title: Out for a Treat (Tuesday Crossword, January 19)
After Stock Surge, Investors Ask Companies What's Ahead
summary: Rise of major indexes despite the worsening toll of the pandemic underscores the pressure on big companies. Companies reporting results in coming weeks are under heightened pressure to spell out how their performance in 2021 is likely to justify share-price gains notched during an epic stock-market rally.

title: Navalny's Arrest and the West
summary: More than rhetorical protests will be needed to get Putin's attention.. Russian authorities detained opposition leader Alexei Navalny upon his return to Moscow over the weekend, five months after he survived an assassination attempt in Siberia. His personal courage is as notable as Vladimir Putin's fear of his appeal.

title: Argentina Is a Testing Ground for Moscow's Global Vaccine Drive
summary: First major country outside Russia to begin mass inoculation against Covid-19 using Sputnik despite questions about the shot's efficacy. Russia is selling millions of doses of its homegrown Sputnik V vaccine abroad, making it a major supplier of a shot that could give Moscow a valuable slice of the global Covid-19 vaccine market and potentially earn Russia geopolitical clout in the developing world.

title: About China's Booming* GDP
summary: *Good data mask dangerous imbalances that are growing worse.. The economic data Beijing released Monday seems to suggest that China has met expectations that it would be the only major economy to grow in 2020. China being China, there's much more-and less-to the story.

title: Harris Will Balance Roles as Counselor to Biden, Tiebreaker in Senate
summary: The new vice president will spend much of her time helping to shepherd the Biden agenda through a 50-50 Senate. WASHINGTON-Upon being sworn in as vice president Wednesday, Kamala Harris will have to balance multiple roles: as a counselor to President-elect Joe Biden, the Senate tiebreaker and the potential standard-bearer for the Democratic Party whose current leaders are in their 70s or 80s.

title: Blinken's Ties to Biden Will Make Him a Unique Secretary of State
summary: Relationship with President-elect spans two decades, although they haven't always seen eye-to-eye; confirmation hearing set for Tuesday. Antony Blinken has one big advantage if confirmed as secretary of state: a nearly two decadelong relationship with President-elect Joe Biden that will enable him to negotiate with allies and adversaries backed by the full authority of the White House.

title: Hawley Strikes Book Deal With Regnery After Capitol Riot Backlash
summary: Regnery will publish the Missouri Republican's book on technology companies after Simon & Schuster canceled its deal. Conservative book publisher Regnery Publishing said it would release Sen. Josh Hawley's "The Tyranny of Big Tech," after Simon & Schuster canceled its deal with the lawmaker over his role in the events at the U.S. Capitol on Jan. 6.

title: Norway Warns Against Vaccinating the Terminally Ill
summary: Authorities have reported 23 cases of elderly recipients suffering from serious medical conditions dying days after being inoculated. The Norwegian drug agency on Monday warned medical authorities in the country not to administer the Covid-19 vaccine to terminally-ill patients because a small number of elderly people had died shortly after receiving the shot in recent days.

title: Navalny Urges Protests Against His Detention in Russia
summary: Opposition leader was detained on his return to Russia after surviving a poison attack last August. MOSCOW-Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny urged supporters to take to the streets as he was ordered to be held in pretrial custody for 30 days, while Russia's foreign ministry warned Western countries not to interfere in a case that is already worsening tensions with the U.S. and Europe.

title: New York City's Union Square Park to Grow Under $100 Million Plan
summary: The plan would incorporate areas outside the present-day park into the footprint. Union Square Park could be in line for a $100 million makeover that will greatly expand its footprint.

title: What's on Biden's Business and Economic To-Do List
summary: Higher corporate tax rates, clean-energy initiatives and more will likely have to wait for Covid-19 stimulus. Early in the Democratic presidential primary campaign, much of the debate revolved around tax, regulatory and legislative proposals deeply significant to business.

title: Tesla Starts Delivering China-Made Model Y Crossover
summary: Model Y is the second vehicle Tesla is making in China, the world's biggest EV market. SHANGHAI- Tesla Inc. delivered its first made-in-China Model Y compact crossover vehicles on Monday, the latest milestone in the American company's drive into the world's largest market for electric cars.

title: Does Getting the Covid-19 Vaccine Stop You Spreading It? Scientists Don't Know Yet.
summary: Pfizer and Moderna are gathering more evidence about whether vaccinated people can still spread the virus. The Covid-19 vaccines authorized in the U.S. are approximately 95% effective at preventing people from getting sick with symptoms, according to Pfizer and Moderna, the companies that produce them. But scientists are still studying whether vaccination prevents transmission to others.

title: Face Masks Are Disrupting a Key Tool of Communication
summary: Take a quiz to guess the emotions behind the masks.

title: Former Florida Covid-19 Data Analyst Rebekah Jones Arrested
summary: Data portal creator faces charge of illegally accessing state-run computer system. Florida law-enforcement officials have arrested a former state Department of Health data analyst suspected of illegally accessing a state-run messaging system used by emergency personnel.

title: Saudi Arabia Curbs Death Penalty in Move to Soften Image
summary: The kingdom imposed a moratorium on capital punishment for drug-related offenses. RIYADH, Saudi Arabia-Saudi Arabia said Monday it had imposed a moratorium on capital punishment for drug-related offenses that led to an 85% reduction in executions, as the conservative Muslim kingdom seeks to soften its image to attract Western tourists and foreign investment.

title: Pizza Hut Hopes Drop Zones Can Help Bring Drone Delivery to Fruition
summary: Drivers, not hungry customers, will collect pies from the sky in an Israeli trial. Pizza Hut Israel is trying a new approach to make pie deliveries by drone a reality at last, but it means customers won't get the thrill of accepting their orders from futuristic flying machines themselves.

title: Biden to Pick Chopra to Lead Consumer Watchdog
summary: Rohit Chopra is the former student-loan ombudsman at the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau. WASHINGTON-President-elect Joe Biden plans to nominate Rohit Chopra, the former student-loan watchdog at the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, to lead the agency, the transition team announced Monday.

title: U.S. Figure Skaters Punched Their Tickets to the Worlds-If It Happens
summary: The coronavirus pandemic has shredded the international competition calendar, and the mess will run all the way to the 2022 Olympics. The United States has crowned its 2021 national figure skating champions this weekend. What happens next is anyone's guess.

title: More Finance Chiefs Resigned in 2020 Than in Previous Years
summary: Thirty-seven CFOs stepped down from S&P 500 companies, up 27.6% from 2019. More chief financial officers resigned from large U.S. companies in 2020 than in previous years, as the pandemic put pressure on corporate balance sheets and the executives who manage them.

title: 'Covid Triangle' Emerges in London as U.K. Variant Rampages
summary: Resume Subscription. LONDON-For more than a century, John Harris's family-run funeral home has buried people from London's working-class East End. He says he has never seen death on the scale wrought by Covid-19.

title: Biden's Climate Plan to Get a Boost From Democrat-Led Senate
summary: But with Democrats holding a razor-thin margin, GOP and industry support likely still needed. WASHINGTON-When President-elect Joe Biden's advisers wrote his climate plan, they often had one small audience in mind: the U.S. Senate.

title: Dollar Rises but Traders Expect Strength to Be Short-Lived
summary: Greenback edged higher after Journal reported that Janet Yellen would diverge from Trump's weaker-dollar-is-better stance. The dollar is up more than 1.5% against a basket of other major currencies since its recent low, confounding expectations of a tumbling greenback in 2021. Some investors and analysts expect any strength to be short-lived.

title: Blacklists Are the Rage in Publishing
summary: Why the house I run will bring out Josh Hawley's new book.. I am an independent book publisher, and in recent days I have been taking calls from journalists asking which authors I would refuse to publish. That's an odd question to ask an American publisher, but suddenly it seems to be on everyone's mind in our industry. Some 250 self-described "publishing professionals"-mostly junior employees of major houses-have issued a statement titled "No Book Deals for Traitors," a category in which they include any "participant" in the Trump administration.

title: Covid Relief, Italian-Style
summary: The ruling coalition collapses in a fight over spending EU money.. A new year brings a new political crisis for Italy, as former Prime Minister Matteo Renzi withdrew last week from the motley coalition government in Rome. Setting aside the operatic personal feuds in play, this episode highlights a serious challenge for Europe as Covid-19 spending relief efforts get underway in earnest.

title: The Flint Water Indictments
summary: Years later, Democratic prosecutors charge former Gov. Rick Snyder.. Nine people, including former Michigan Gov. Rick Snyder, were criminally charged last week in connection with the yearslong crisis in Flint's drinking water. The public indictments are terse, with little evidence. So it's difficult not to wonder if the case against Mr. Snyder, especially, is politicizing the tragedy.

title: I Wanted Something That Belonged to My Grandfather. I Discovered a Piece of History.
summary: An old field notebook transported me to the historic, civil-rights march from Selma to Montgomery, Ala.. When a package arrived from my cousin on my doorstep in November, I opened it carefully but a little anxiously, not sure just what lay inside.

title: Jeep-Maker Stellantis Needs to Go Global
summary: Car giant formed from the merger of Fiat Chrysler and French peer PSA can make valuable cost savings but also has some expensive problems. The merger of Fiat Chrysler and its French peer PSA will create a trans-Atlantic giant out of two smaller car makers. One of its biggest challenges is to go truly global.

title: Companies Brace Themselves for New ESG Regulations Under Biden
summary: Businesses and trade groups are hoping to get clarity about-and influence-expected rules on environmental, social and governance issues. Companies are bracing for further regulation under the incoming Biden administration. One area that could affect a number of industries: potential new requirements related to diversity, carbon emissions and other types of sustainability metrics.

title: Remote Work Pushes Transit Agencies to Rethink Monthly Rail Passes
summary: Officials are devising new ticket types, incentives for workers who may wish to work from home more often. Hanan Kolko traveled by train or bus to New York City from his home in Montclair, N.J., for almost 25 years until the coronavirus pandemic forced him to work from home.

title: The Geezer, Still a Goat: Ageless Tom Brady's at It Again
summary: A Hall of Fame quarterback has a new team in yet another conference title game. Green Bay looms. Tom Brady needs to settle down. He's making the rest of us look bad. Another Super Bowl is on the verge, and once more, here is Brady, age 78, or rather 43, solid arm, fab mane, on a new team, in a new state, amid a new conference, and, after Tampa Bay's 30-20 victory over New Orleans on Sunday, just one win away from reaching the NFL's grandest stage, for the 10th time in his historic career.

title: New Jersey County Breaks Through Vaccine Barriers
summary: Resume Subscription. LIVINGSTON, N.J.-Before the Covid-19 pandemic, Maya Lordo was working to implement a plastic-straw ban.

title: Why Dapper Dan Does 600 Sit-Ups Every Morning
summary: The 76-year-old designer and Gucci collaborator on his morning routine and daily exercise regimen: "I lay in bed and do 150 leg-ups". If you're familiar with the logo-heavy outfits that music stars like Billie Eilish, Maluma and Offset wear, then you're familiar with the influence of designer Dapper Dan. The 76-year-old Harlem-based couturier's impact can be found on those artists as well as on the streetwear-style clothing that fashion houses like Gucci, Louis Vuitton and Fendi have put on the runway in recent years. As rapper and producer Missy Elliott wrote in Time, Dapper Dan is "the blueprint for our culture in hip-hop."

title: Morgan Wallen Tops Charts Driving Surge in Country Music Streaming
summary: The 27-year-old star breaks record for most streams by a country album in a week. Morgan Wallen broke the record for the most streams by a country album in a week, as country music gets more traction online and becomes a bigger part of overall listening on streaming services.

title: Productivity Tips for Procrastinators
summary: The pandemic and working from home have sapped motivation at work for many. Here are some ways to tackle a growing to-do list.. To hear Piers Steel tell it, the whole thing isn't our fault.

title: Top 10 Global Consumer Trends for 2021
summary: Spurred by the Covid-19 pandemic, outdoor pursuits, digital convenience and safety obsession are seen having a lasting impact. Many of the new habits consumers formed during the coronavirus pandemic are here to stay, market researcher Euromonitor International predicts.

title: Biotech's Price Tag Is Crazy but Not Insane
summary: Startup Sana Biotechnology could go public at a $10 billion valuation. Recent history suggests the high price tag may be worth it.. A biotechnology startup is poised to go public with a roughly $10 billion price tag a year before it begins human clinical trials for its drug candidates. That isn't as crazy as it sounds.

title: Samsung Is Without a Leader as Jay Y. Lee Returns to Prison
summary: Tech giant is rudderless for the second time in four years. SEOUL- Samsung 's de facto leader, Lee Jae-yong, returned to prison, throwing the South Korean conglomerate into disarray during a generational transfer of power.

title: Intel Will Demand More Than Just Engineering
summary: Turning around the chip maker will require not only sorting out manufacturing problems but also selling stakeholders on tough decisions about the company's future. How hard will the new Intel chief executive's job be? The company's top rival just gave some important clues.

title: Capitol Riot Becomes Civics Lessons in Schools
summary: Teachers face difficult questions from students; others point to the need for better civics curriculum, funding. At the start of class, Logan Ridenour reminded the high school juniors of the ground rules for discussing the Capitol riot: Everyone is entitled to their own opinion and everyone should be a respectful listener.

title: France, Once a Vaccine Pioneer, Is Top Skeptic in Covid-19 Pandemic
summary: Covid-19 vaccination campaign off to a glacial start, as it meets some of the world's highest skepticism rates. 'I can't be the guinea pig.'. Audrey Courreges's mistrust of new coronavirus vaccines runs so deep that she's told the nursing home where she works, in the southern French town of Beziers, that she won't take the vaccinations or administer them.

title: Shareholder Proposal at Omnicom Questions Ad Buyers' Role in Online Hate
summary: Omnicom and Home Depot shareholders filed resolutions calling for their companies to investigate whether their ad buys lead to 'violations of civil or human rights'. Shareholders are taking aim at buyers of social-media advertising for their possible role in spreading disinformation and hate speech.

title: Capitol Riot Shakes Global Pro-Democracy Campaigners
summary: Rivals cite America's election unrest as evidence that their political systems are superior. As a young student activist in 1980s Communist Poland, Tomasz Siemoniak-like many pro-democracy campaigners world-wide-looked up to America as a beacon of freedom.

title: China Still Grew and Fueled Its Rise as Covid-19 Shook the Global Economy
summary: GDP rose 2.3% last year, making China the only major world economy to record gains. BEIJING-China's geopolitical rise over the past four decades has been fueled by sizzling economic growth that regularly featured years of double-digit percentage-point gains.

title: China Is Only Major Economy to Report 2020 Growth
summary: GDP rises 6.5% from a year earlier in the fourth quarter. BEIJING-China's economy expanded by 2.3% in 2020, roaring back from a historic contraction in the early months of the year to become the only major world economy to grow in what was a pandemic-ravaged year.

title: For Joe Biden, Daunting-and Unprecedented-Challenges
summary: The new president faces a global pandemic and a large group of people who have been convinced his election isn't legitimate. And that's just the start of it.. Every new president and Congress face their own particular set of challenges, which tend at the outset to feel both unique and daunting-though sometimes they actually aren't as new and momentous as they seem.

title: These Companies Want to Charge Your Electric Vehicle as You Drive
summary: Auto makers and utilities hope wireless charging on roads can calm EV-range anxiety, but questions remain about costs.

title: U.K. Gets In on Global M&A Surge
summary: Investors bet on higher offers for Entain, G4S, Signature Aviation. The U.K. is finally joining the global resurgence in mergers and acquisitions.

title: Your Movie Is About to Be...Delayed, Again
summary: 'Spider-Man' spinoff is latest movie to be delayed amid Covid-19 surge as industry faces pileup of unreleased films. LOS ANGELES-When it comes to the movie release calendar, Hollywood studios are stuck in a "Groundhog Day" routine of delays.

title: The Kansas City Chiefs Won-and Lost Patrick Mahomes
summary: The Kansas City Chiefs advanced to the AFC Championship but their superstar quarterback left with a concussion. History shows it may be difficult for him to return in time.. The Kansas City Chiefs had a safe lead against the Cleveland Browns when the one thing that couldn't happen to them did. They lost Patrick Mahomes.

title: China's Growth: Don't Mistake the Cyclical for the Structural
summary: China handled the pandemic well, but it was also lucky. A strong 2021 seems assured, but 2022 and beyond could be challenging.. By the terrible standards of 2020, China's 2.3% growth stands out. That sets the country up well for a strong 2021, before some familiar challenges reassert themselves.

title: Richard Branson's Virgin Orbit Reaches Space
summary: Startup deploys tiny satellites into orbit in successful demonstration flight. A venture to launch small satellites using a rocket fired from a converted jumbo jet deployed 10 tiny ones into orbit for the first time Sunday, providing a big boost for the startup founded by entrepreneur Richard Branson.

title: Record Liquefied Natural Gas Prices in Asia Won't Last
summary: A cold snap and a supply crunch have created a perfect storm, but the pendulum is likely to swing the other way soon. It's been a wild year for commodity markets, marked by despair last spring as the world ground to a halt and followed more recently by exuberance. Nowhere has the bullish feeling been more evident than the usually staid market for liquefied natural gas: February futures for Asian gas hit nearly $20 per million British thermal units last week according to data from Refinitiv. As recently as mid-December, they were only trading around $8 per MMBtu.

title: Keystone XL Oil Project Pledges Zero Carbon Emissions
summary: Controversial pipeline would be powered by renewables, built by union labor in bid to avoid ax from Biden. WASHINGTON-The Keystone oil pipeline's developer plans to announce a series of overhauls-including a pledge to use only renewable energy-in a bid to win President-elect Joe Biden's support for the controversial project.

title: Far-Right Affiliations Seen Among Those Recently Charged in Capitol Riot
summary: Alleged members of Oath Keepers, Three Percenters join Proud Boys on federal charge sheets. WASHINGTON-Members of several far-right militant groups were charged or arrested over the weekend for allegedly participating in the Jan. 6 riot at the U.S. Capitol, as investigators examine what kind of organization and planning might have gone into the attack.

title: Photos: Ahead of Inauguration, Sparse Protests, Heavy Security at State Capitols
summary: Resume Subscription. Small groups of armed political protesters gathered outside a few heavily guarded state capitol buildings on Sunday.

title: Phil Spector, Pop-Music Revolutionary Who Was Convicted of Murder, Dies at 81
summary: Producer transformed pop and rock with his 'wall of sound' technique; hits included 'You've Lost That Lovin' Feelin' ' and 'Be My Baby'. Phil Spector, a towering figure in the history of 20th-century pop music who was known for his symphonic "wall of sound" production technique and who was later convicted of second-degree murder, died Saturday at the age of 81.
